title: Cognitive Load Theory-Based Mathematics Presentation Design Workshop

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical concepts, proficiency in basic use of presentation tools
context.additional_context: Utilization of VR simulation tools within smartphone-centric limited tech environments.

learning_goals: Learners can distinguish and explain the three types of cognitive load (intrinsic, extraneous, germane) from Cognitive Load Theory (CLT) when designing presentations.
Learners can apply five strategies to reduce extraneous cognitive load in presentations for mathematics concept delivery.
Learners can develop interactive mathematics presentation prototypes in a VR environment and improve them through peer evaluation.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
